verses.verse: Thus the heavens <S%H8064><s%> and the earth <S%H776><s%> were finished, <S%H3615><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the host <S%H6635><s%> of them.

And on the seventh <S%H7637><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> God <S%H430><s%> ended <S%H3615><s%> his work <S%H4399><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he had made; <S%H6213><s%> and he rested <S%H7673><s%> on the seventh <S%H7637><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> from all <S%H3605><s%> his work <S%H4399><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he had made. <S%H6213><s%>

And God <S%H430><s%> blessed <S%H1288><s%> the seventh <S%H7637><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> and sanctified <S%H6942><s%> it: because <S%H3588><s%> that in it he had rested <S%H7673><s%> from all <S%H3605><s%> his work <S%H4399><s%> which <S%H834><s%> God <S%H430><s%> created <S%H1254><s%> and made. <S%H6213><s%>

These <S%H428><s%> are the generations <S%H8435><s%> of the heavens <S%H8064><s%> and of the earth <S%H776><s%> when they were created, <S%H1254><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> that the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> and the heavens, <S%H8064><s%>

And every <S%H3605><s%> plant <S%H7880><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> before <S%H2962><s%> it was in the earth, <S%H776><s%> and every <S%H3605><s%> herb <S%H6212><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> before <S%H2962><s%> it grew: <S%H6779><s%> for the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> had not caused it to rain <S%H4305><s%> on the earth, <S%H776><s%> and there was not a man <S%H120><s%> to till <S%H5647><s%> the ground. <S%H127><s%>
But there went <S%H5927><s%> up a mist <S%H108><s%> from the earth, <S%H776><s%> and watered <S%H8248><s%> the whole <S%H854><s%> <S%H3605><s%> face <S%H6440><s%> of the ground. <S%H127><s%>

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> formed <S%H3335><s%> man <S%H120><s%> of the dust <S%H6083><s%> of the ground, <S%H127><s%> and breathed <S%H5301><s%> into his nostrils <S%H639><s%> the breath <S%H5397><s%> of life; <S%H2416><s%> and man <S%H120><s%> became <S%H1961><s%> a living <S%H2416><s%> soul. <S%H5315><s%>

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> planted <S%H5193><s%> a garden <S%H1588><s%> eastward <S%H6924><s%> in Eden; <S%H5731><s%> and there <S%H8033><s%> he put <S%H7760><s%> the man <S%H120><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> he had formed. <S%H3335><s%>

And out of the ground <S%H127><s%> made the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> to grow <S%H6779><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> tree <S%H6086><s%> that is pleasant <S%H2530><s%> to the sight, <S%H4758><s%> and good <S%H2896><s%> for food; <S%H3978><s%> the tree <S%H6086><s%> of life <S%H2416><s%> also in the middle <S%H8432><s%> of the garden, <S%H1588><s%> and the tree <S%H6086><s%> of knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of good <S%H2896><s%> and evil. <S%H7451><s%>

And a river <S%H5104><s%> went <S%H3318><s%> out of Eden <S%H5731><s%> to water <S%H8248><s%> the garden; <S%H1588><s%> and from there <S%H8033><s%> it was parted, <S%H6504><s%> and became <S%H1961><s%> into four <S%H702><s%> heads. <S%H7218><s%>

The name <S%H8034><s%> of the first <S%H259><s%> is Pison: <S%H6376><s%> that is it which compasses <S%H5437><s%> the whole <S%H854><s%> <S%H3605><s%> land <S%H776><s%> of Havilah, <S%H2341><s%> where <S%H834><s%> <S%H8033><s%> there is gold; <S%H2091><s%>
And the gold <S%H2091><s%> of that land <S%H776><s%> is good: <S%H2896><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> is bdellium <S%H916><s%> and the onyx <S%H7718><s%> stone. <S%H68><s%>

And the name <S%H8034><s%> of the second <S%H8145><s%> river <S%H5104><s%> is Gihon: <S%H1521><s%> the same <S%H1931><s%> is it that compasses <S%H5437><s%> the whole <S%H854><s%> <S%H3605><s%> land <S%H776><s%> of Ethiopia. <S%H3568><s%>

And the name <S%H8034><s%> of the third <S%H7992><s%> river <S%H5104><s%> is Hiddekel: <S%H2313><s%> that is it which goes <S%H1980><s%> toward the east <S%H6926><s%> of Assyria. <S%H804><s%> And the fourth <S%H7243><s%> river <S%H5104><s%> is Euphrates. <S%H6578><s%>

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> the man, <S%H120><s%> and put <S%H3240><s%> him into the garden <S%H1588><s%> of Eden <S%H5731><s%> to dress <S%H5647><s%> it and to keep <S%H8104><s%> it.

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> commanded <S%H6680><s%> the man, <S%H120><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> Of every <S%H3605><s%> tree <S%H6086><s%> of the garden <S%H1588><s%> you may freely eat: <S%H398><s%>

But of the tree <S%H6086><s%> of the knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of good <S%H2896><s%> and evil, <S%H7451><s%> you shall not eat <S%H398><s%> of it: for in the day <S%H3117><s%> that you eat <S%H398><s%> thereof you shall surely die. <S%H4191><s%>

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> It is not good <S%H2896><s%> that the man <S%H120><s%> should be alone; <S%H905><s%> I will make <S%H6213><s%> him an help <S%H5828><s%> meet <S%H5048><s%> for him.

And out of the ground <S%H127><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> formed <S%H3335><s%> every beast <S%H2416><s%> of the field, <S%H7704><s%> and every <S%H3605><s%> fowl <S%H5775><s%> of the air; <S%H8064><s%> and brought <S%H935><s%> them to Adam <S%H120><s%> to see <S%H7200><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> he would call <S%H7121><s%> them: and whatever <S%H3605><s%> <S%H834><s%> Adam <S%H120><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> living <S%H2416><s%> creature, <S%H5315><s%> that was the name <S%H8034><s%> thereof.

And Adam <S%H120><s%> gave <S%H7121><s%> names <S%H8034><s%> to all <S%H3605><s%> cattle, <S%H929><s%> and to the fowl <S%H5775><s%> of the air, <S%H8064><s%> and to every <S%H3605><s%> beast <S%H2416><s%> of the field; <S%H7704><s%> but for Adam <S%H120><s%> there was not found <S%H4672><s%> an help <S%H5828><s%> meet <S%H5828><s%> for him.

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> caused a deep <S%H8639><s%> sleep <S%H3462><s%> to fall <S%H5307><s%> on Adam, <S%H121><s%> and he slept: <S%H3462><s%> and he took <S%H3947><s%> one <S%H259><s%> of his ribs, <S%H6763><s%> and closed <S%H5462><s%> up the flesh <S%H1320><s%> instead <S%H8478><s%> thereof;

And the rib, <S%H6763><s%> which <S%H834><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> had taken <S%H3947><s%> from man, <S%H120><s%> made <S%H1129><s%> he a woman, <S%H802><s%> and brought <S%H935><s%> her to the man. <S%H120><s%>

And Adam <S%H120><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> This <S%H2063><s%> is now <S%H6471><s%> bone <S%H6106><s%> of my bones, <S%H6106><s%> and flesh <S%H1320><s%> of my flesh: <S%H1320><s%> she shall be called <S%H7121><s%> Woman, <S%H802><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> she was taken <S%H3947><s%> out of Man. <S%H376><s%>

Therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> shall a man <S%H376><s%> leave <S%H5800><s%> his father <S%H1><s%> and his mother, <S%H517><s%> and shall join <S%H1692><s%> to his wife: <S%H802><s%> and they shall be one <S%H259><s%> flesh. <S%H1320><s%>
And they were both <S%H8147><s%> naked, <S%H6174><s%> the man <S%H120><s%> and his wife, <S%H802><s%> and were not ashamed. <S%H954><s%>
